meta.purpose: This file contains a short version of risk level definitions used in IPCC reports; Reports such as the special report on climate change and land (SRCCL) includes an even shorter version in their SPM, without explicit reference to 'key risks', while AR6 WGII SPM includes a somewhat longer definition, with more information on the 'magnitude' criteria (see included references'.
meta.sources: For more information about the definition of risk levels, see for example IPCC, 2022. Summary for Policymakers. Pörtner, H. O., Roberts, D. C., Tignor, M., Poloczanska, E. meta.warnings: This file is subject to change in the future; it should provide the default values for the ColourPalettes

undetectable.definition: No impacts are detectable and attributable to climate change [Definition since AR5].

moderate.definition: Impacts are both detectable and attributable to climate change with at least medium confidence, also accounting for the other criteria for key risks: magnitude, likelihood, temporality/persistance, and ability to respond (including through adaptation) [Definition since AR5].

high.definition: Severe and widespread impacts that are judged to be high on one or more criteria for key risks: magnitude, likelihood, temporality/persistance, and ability to respond (including through adaptation) [Definition since AR5].

very high.definition: Very high risk of severe impacts and the presence of significant irreversibility or the persistence of climate-related hazards, combined with limited ability to adapt due to the nature of the hazard or impacts/risks [Definition since AR5].
